newsitem.title: UK: BDB says in link-up talks with new sat TV group.
newsitem.headline: BDB says in link-up talks with new sat TV group.

text.p: British Digital Broadcasting (BDB), a UK consortium of television giants bidding for rights to offer digital terrestrial TV services, said on Thursday it was in talks for collaboration with British Interactive Broadcasting (BIB), the newly formed satellite TV group.

Pay television giant British Sky Broadcasting Group Plc announced on Wednesday the formation of BIB which would also include British Telecommunications, Midland Bank and Japan's Matsushita Electric Works to provide services like home shopping and banking along with about 200 satellite channels.
BDB, formed by Carlton Communications, Granada Group and BSkyB, applied to UK authorities in January to operate three digital terrestrial TV licenses.
BDB's director Nigel Walmsley welcomed the creation of BIB saying it would accelerate BDB's prospects to offer a wider range of interactive services.
"BDB and BIB are in active discussions about collaboration between the parties to enhance the interactive opportunities afforded by BDB's plans for digital terrestrial television," Walmsley said.
The terrestrial group plans to provide a minimum of 15 channels including nine new channels ahead of a progressive introduction of additional interactive services.
BDB is expecting a decision from UK authorities on its application by the end of this month.
